Uses of Class
android.widget.TextView

Packages that use TextView
android.app High-level classes encapsulating the overall Android application model. 
android.inputmethodservice Base classes for writing input methods. 
android.text.method Provides classes that monitor or modify keypad input. 
android.text.util Utilities for converting identifiable text strings into clickable links and creating RFC 822-type message (SMTP) tokens. 
android.webkit Provides tools for browsing the web. 
android.widget The widget package contains (mostly visual) UI elements to use on your Application screen.

Uses of TextView in android.text.util
 

Methods in android.text.util with parameters of type TextView
static boolean Linkify.addLinks(TextView text, int mask)
          Scans the text of the provided TextView and turns all occurrences of the link types indicated in the mask into clickable links.
static void Linkify.addLinks(TextView text, Pattern pattern, String scheme)
          Applies a regex to the text of a TextView turning the matches into links.

Subclasses of TextView in android.webkit
(package private)  class TextDialog
          TextDialog is a specialized version of EditText used by WebView to overlay html textfields (and textareas) to use our standard text editing.
 

Uses of TextView in android.widget
 

Subclasses of TextView in android.widget
 class AutoCompleteTextView
          An editable text view that shows completion suggestions automatically while the user is typing.
 class Button
           Button represents a push-button widget.
 class CheckBox
           A checkbox is a specific type of two-states button that can be either checked or unchecked.
 class CheckedTextView
          An extension to TextView that supports the Checkable interface.
 class Chronometer
          Class that implements a simple timer.
 class CompoundButton
           A button with two states, checked and unchecked.
 class DigitalClock
          Like AnalogClock, but digital.
 class EditText
          EditText is a thin veneer over TextView that configures itself to be editable.
 class MultiAutoCompleteTextView
          An editable text view, extending AutoCompleteTextView, that can show completion suggestions for the substring of the text where the user is typing instead of necessarily for the entire thing.
 class RadioButton
           A radio button is a two-states button that can be either checked or unchecked.
 class ToggleButton
          Displays checked/unchecked states as a button with a "light" indicator and by default accompanied with the text "ON" or "OFF".

Methods in android.widget with parameters of type TextView
 void SimpleCursorAdapter.setViewText(TextView v, String text)
          Called by bindView() to set the text for a TextView but only if there is no existing ViewBinder or if the existing ViewBinder cannot handle binding to an TextView.

          Called by bindView() to set the text for a TextView but only if there is no existing ViewBinder or if the existing ViewBinder cannot handle binding to an TextView.
